document.docAuthor: Stroiński, Adam, Malenovský, Igor & Świerczewski, Dariusz
document.docTitle: Socoflata Stroiński & Malenovský & Świerczewski 2018, gen. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Socoflata gen. nov., described for two new planthopper species from the mountains in Socotra island (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Socoflata gen. nov., described for two new planthopper species from the mountains in Socotra island (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Flatidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species .
Socoflata histrionica
sp. nov.
, here designated.

Diagnosis .
Socoflata
gen. nov.
can be distinguished from other genera of Flatidae by the combination of following characters: Body small, ovoid, habitus issid-like. Vertex transverse, distinctly shorter than pronotum at midline, with all margins carinate, fore margin truncate. Disc of frons tricarinate, all carinae sharp and well distinct, reaching almost frontoclypeal suture, basally separated. Tegmen short, coriaceous, with sutural angle rounded. Male anal tube, in lateral view, elongate and curved, with ventral margin strongly concave. Male genital style widening apicad; postero-dorsal angle with long and curved capitulum, postero-ventral angle produced into a large tooth. Periandrium bearing 3-armed appendage oriented antero-ventrad; posterior arm simple, oriented dorsoposteriad; median arm stout, diverged into two processes, upper process with 0–3 ventral spine-like ramifications; anterior arm simple, movable. Female gonapophysis VIII stout, laterally flattened, ventral margin sinuate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–10.
Socoflata
spp., habitus in lateral and dorsal views (females). (1–2)
S. histrionica
sp. nov.
; (3–10)
S. aurolineata
sp. nov.

FIGURES 11–16.
Socoflata histrionica
sp. nov .
, SEM photographs. (11) Habitus, lateral view; (12) same, dorsal view; (13) anterior part of body, dorsal view; (14) same; dorso-lateral view; (15) mesonotum, dorsal view; (16) vertex and pronotum, dorsal view.

FIGURES 17–22.
Socoflata histrionica
sp. nov .
, SEM photographs. (17) anterior part of body, fronto-dorsal view; (18) same, frontal view; (19) frons, frontal view; (20) head, lateral view; (21, 22) antenna.

FIGURES 23–28.
Socoflata aurolineata
sp. nov .
, SEM photographs. (23) fore- and midleg; (24) tegmen; vein sensory structures; (25, 26) same, basal half; (27, 28) same, apical half.

FIGURES 29–34.
Socoflata aurolineata
sp. nov .
, male, SEM photographs. (29) Abdomen, dorsal view; (30) terminalia, dorsal view; (31) abdomen, lateral view; (32) terminalia, lateral view; (33) abdomen, postero-ventral view; (34) terminalia, posteroventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The generic name is a combination derived from “ Socotra ” and “ Flata ” which is used here for a representative of the Flatidae family. Gender feminine.
